quest.name: The One That Got Away
journal: Guildmaster Luciane is having a heated discussion with Silvairre. Perhaps you should intervene.
Silvairre reveals that he has discovered the whereabouts of Pawah Mujuuk, before rushing off alone to apprehend her. Follow him to the South Shroud and see that he comes to no harm.

You find Silvairre surrounded by the bodies of an unknown gang of poachers, exhausted but unharmed. After you dispatch a pursuing party of assailants, the Elezen explains his plan to lure Pawah out of hiding. Make your way to the specified clearing and use the bone whistle Silvairre has given you to summon Pawah and her gang.
After a fierce battle, the three of you successfully subdue Pawah and consign her infamous gang to history. Return to the Archers' Guild and share the tale of your triumph with Luciane.

Luciane is glad of your safe return, and proud to have such a dedicated and compassionate adventurer in her ranks. By way of thanks for your continued contribution to the guild, she teaches you a new technique: Windbite. Though the road to mastery is long and easily lost, Luciane is confident that you will find your way.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Thank the gods you've come, Forename! Perhaps you can talk some sense into this stubborn fool!

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Calm yourself, Silvairre. At least let us petition the Order of the Twin Adder for─

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: There is no time, Luciane! Pawah would be long gone before their forces had even assembled!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Alone, I can move more swiftly, take these poachers by surprise, and force them to divulge her location.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: We understand how you feel, Silvairre, but this is too reckless! At least permit Forename and me to accompany you.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: You? The adventurer and the savage? You do not─you cannot understand.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Silvairre!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: But I do understand! I know what it means to take pride in your home, to want more than anything to protect it...and to be consumed by guilt when you cannot. I see what you're going through, Silvairre, and I...I understand.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: This guild taught me to open my eyes and see clearly. I beg you, Silvairre, open yours! You have friends here, ready to fight. You have us.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: ...I have never considered you my friends. Do not follow me.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: ...Well his lying certainly hasn't improved. <sigh>

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: If he honestly thinks he's doing us a favor by forbidding us from getting involved, he's an even bigger fool than I imagined. Come, Forename! To the South Shroud!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> Well this is...unfortunate.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Silvairre!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Leih!? Forename!? I told you not to follow me! I neither need nor want─

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Don't take me for a fool. You cannot conceal the truth from this archer's eye!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Forename, the others are almost upon us. We must make our stand here and protect Silvairre!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: ...I told you, I do not need or want your assistance. Quite why you have deluded yourselves into thinking─

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: You're the one who's deluded! Thinking you could deceive us, when even a blind man could see that you cover your mouth every time you tell a lie.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Observe with intent, overlooking not the smallest detail. Discern your subject's unique characteristics, and recognize patterns in their behavior.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I learned these things from Luciane...and from you.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: And I'll be damned if I'm going to watch you get yourself killed! There's still so much I don't know about Gridania and Wildwood archery, so much that I...that I need you to teach me!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: ...Hmph. I suppose fixing your form is the least I can do.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Why, you─

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Pawah's gang is already on the move. We have but one chance to catch them.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Poachers throughout the Twelveswood use bone whistles like this one to communicate. With it, I believe we can lure Pawah out of hiding─assuming she has not moved on.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: So that's why you came to Takers' Rot...for this gang's whistle.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Forename─if you are determined to help me, I have a task for you.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Pawah was last seen near Issom-Har. To the east of the camp, through a hollow tree trunk, is a clearing where two streams meet, and efts are wont to congregate. We will lay our trap there, and you will be the bait.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Do not fear, Forename. I swear on my honor as a Gridanian archer that no harm will come to you.

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Bollocks. I knew I should've trusted me gut.

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: ...Some blokes just can't take a hint.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: I do hope you will forgive my forwardness, madam.

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: No, no, sir...'tis most flatterin'.

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Wouldn't ye agree, sisters!? Why don't we show our gallant Wildwood admirer an' his mates just how much we appreciate their attentions!?

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: I hope ye like it rough, darlin'!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: And I thought you only had eyes for me...

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: ...I can't...I won't...

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Hmph. Did you learn nothing from my lesson? Your style is far removed from proper Wildwood technique. Still...you acquitted yourself well enough, I suppose.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: I will see to Pawah. Should she try to escape, she will find me far less sympathetic than the last time.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Did you see it, Forename? A perfect shot!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Luciane must hear of this! Let's hurry back to Gridania at once!

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: <groan>

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: I am relieved to see you again, Forename.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Had the three of you not been united in your purpose, Pawah Mujuuk would still be free, and one or more of you would surely be dead.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: I am so proud of you, Forename. Not only have you mastered our teachings, but you have also helped your guildmates regain the perspective that they had lost. For showing such compassion to your peers, I wish to teach you a new technique─Windbite.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: With Windbite, you can bring the power of the very air around you to bear against your opponents. And they will suffer on long after you have nocked your next arrow. It will serve you well in battle, I am certain.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: All archers walk the same path, Forename, towards improvement and discovery. As long as you have the vision to see the path ahead, you will continue to mature and excel.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Yet we all grow weary and lose direction in time. When this befalls you, I have no doubt but that you will find your way back to us.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Trust in your eyes, Forename. They will never lead you astray.

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“The One That Got Away”?

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“The One That Got Away”?

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: UNNOWN
dialogue.text: Brought friends, did ye!? Then ye won't have to die alone!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: If you want him, come and claim him!

dialogue.name: UNNOWN
dialogue.text: Careful, these ones are feisty!

dialogue.name: UNNOWN
dialogue.text: Gridanian bastards! How dare you attack our people!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Ugh... Protect Silvairre... I'll be fine...

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Leih, Forename─deal with the others. Pawah and I have unfinished business.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Heh, as you will!

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: If ye wanted to dance, all ye had to do was ask!

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: My sisters ain't to yer likin'? Too bloody picky, that's yer trouble!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Ugh, my arms...what did you do to me!?

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Bet yer guildmaster never taught ye that one!

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Is it just me, or is it gettin' a bit chilly out?

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Don't worry, folks─I'll keep ye warm an' toasty!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Leih, Forename─spread out! She has oiled arrows!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Not to you...anyone but you...

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Ugh...so it's to be like that, huh...

obj.n: A Song of Bards and Bowmen
